task_summary: The robot arm is tasked to pick up a red cylindrical object from a black tabletop using visual perception and grasping actions.

task_long_description.overview: This episode features a robot arm assigned to locate, approach, and pick up a small red cylinder placed on a black table. Blue tape markers are present nearby for calibration or referencing. The arm uses onboard vision to detect the target object, moves above it, aligns precisely, and grasps using a parallel-jaw gripper. Once grasped, it lifts the object gently off the tabletop, pausing briefly to confirm success.
preconditions: Red object present and stationary on the tabletop
Table area is clear of obstructions
stepwise_plan: Check if red object is visible
Visually search for red object if not detected
Detect precise pose of red object
Move above red object with safe offset
Approach and align with tight tolerance
Verify object is securely in gripper
Lift (raise) the object off the table
success_criteria: Red object is securely held in the gripper and clearly lifted from the table
No collision or object slip occurs during grasp/lift
failure_and_recovery: Object not visible: Retry visual search (up to 3 times)
Grasp fails: Re-align and attempt again
Object slips: Lower and repeat grasp sequence
task_long_description.termination: Task ends successfully when the red object is lifted and held stably above the table, or on failure after retries are exhausted.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: pick up the red object from the table

node_specs.description: Checks if the red object is visually detected
Visually scan the scene using a grid pattern to locate the red object
Detect precise pose/location of the red object
Open the gripper to prepare for grasp
Move end-effector above the red object, offsetting vertically
Align gripper with the object with tight tolerance
Close the gripper with sufficient force to grasp
Checks if the red object is held by the gripper
Lift the red object off the table
Pause briefly to confirm stable grasp

failure_modes: Red object is not visible or goes undetected
Gripper fails to grasp object securely
recovery_strategy: Retry visual search (ScanForTarget) if object not visible
Re-align and repeat grasp if ObjectInGripper condition fails
Abort after 3 retries or escalate to human intervention
assumptions: Red object pose and table location as visually grounded in frames; no unexpected obstructions present
Gripper width (0.06) fits the red object approx. diameter
Approach and grasp directions are top-down as suggested by motion cues
Instruction refers to a single visible red object; blue markers not part of manipulation

expected_success_criteria: Gripper encloses and lifts red object off the table with no slip
Perception pipeline confidently identifies object position
